DataElement.preferredName: Person Histologically Or Cytological Confirmation Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study addressing the histological or cytological verification of thyroid gland carcinoma as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Histologically Or Cytological Procedure Confirmation Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Involving the use of histology or histological techniques._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features._Having been established or verified._A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and undifferentiated (anaplastic) carcinoma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Histologically Or Cytological Procedure Confirmation Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.:Having been established or verified.:A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and undifferentiated (anaplastic) carcinoma.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.
A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic carcinoma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed Papillary Thyroid Cancer (PTC), Follicular Thyroid Cancer (FTC), or Hurtle cell Thyroid Cancer (HTC)?
